info.name: Statoacoustic nerve
info.description: The statoacoustic nerve is AKA the vestibulocochlear nerve. This eighth cranial nerve enters the brainstem at the cerebellopontine angle. It carries information from the hair cell receptors in the organ of Corti of the cochlear duct as well as from the vestibular organs (cristae of the semicircular ducts and maculae of the utricle and saccule of the inner ear).
